spec.name: Abderrahman Slaoui Foundation Museum
spec.description: The Abderrahman Slaoui Foundation Museum is a cultural institution dedicated to preserving and showcasing the personal collection of Abderrahman Slaoui, a prominent Moroccan collector and patron of the arts. Housed in a beautiful Art Deco villa built in 1921, the museum features an impressive collection of Moroccan jewelry, traditional ceramics, zellij (mosaic tilework), and other decorative arts. The museum serves as both a cultural center and a testament to Morocco's rich artistic heritage, offering visitors insight into traditional Moroccan craftsmanship and design.

people.comment: The Museum consists mainly of items from Abderrahman's collection. When he died the museum was created by the foundation he created when he was alive.
